document.title: TEXAS ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS FOR SPANISH LANGUAGE ARTS AND READING AND ENGLISH AS A SECOND LANGUAGE

BA308F15755B483D98508792E055BF32.description: use an appropriate mode of delivery, whether written, oral, or multimodal, to present results.

C38BE5B4DBC44CACA74A78375297BCE0.description: display academic citations and use source materials ethically; and

2145577678184F07AEBF3D418B608849.description: faulty reasoning such as hyperbole, emotional appeals, and stereotype;

7EB14196F6E44A78AEBDA8BE8581548A.description: differentiate between paraphrasing and plagiarism when using source materials;

665C479B71F64DA0961F01A83AD247CA.description: synthesize information from a variety of sources;

EFE539C39677426B9E6CAEDEDED9C802.description: differentiate between primary and secondary sources;

114A846AF81748F7808CA140D6284C01.description: identify and gather relevant information from a variety of sources;

C4F621D22BA04A908DB676DE6754C19F.description: refine the major research question, if necessary, guided by the answers to a secondary set of questions;

EF3A99CF7C544219A4333C4A741393CE.description: generate student-selected and teacher-guided questions for formal and informal inquiry;

A580C64344D84B10A34F9E772160A99E.description: Inquiry and research: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. The student engages in both short-term and sustained recursive inquiry processes for a variety of purposes. The student is expected to:

322B3758531D42E5B1C2D6CC02B7F065.description: compose correspondence that reflects an opinion, registers a complaint, or requests information in a business or friendly structure.

D68CC0E1AA2E4E379D025341A91A5813.description: compose multi-paragraph argumentative texts using genre characteristics and craft; and

048E9001D7CD4E2F93B2F82E57C9CA4F.description: compose informational texts, including multi-paragraph essays that convey information about a topic, using a clear controlling idea or thesis statement and genre characteristics and craft;

205091B3A95D47A6A4B887B146CF9972.description: compose literary texts such as personal narratives, fiction, and poetry using genre characteristics and craft;

C5CC94450F904056AE5E34C25D25EA27.description: Composition: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--genres. The student uses genre characteristics and craft to compose multiple texts that are meaningful. The student is expected to:

A4F2E54CE055451A9E1FF51BEC714016.description: publish written work for appropriate audiences.

D32D158A685844D08B35171F423D5071.description: correct spelling, including commonly confused terms; and

7139608AF36645EE83E409E3BD80B513.description: punctuation marks, including commas in complex sentences, transitions, and introductory elements; and

3DA6F6530066482EAADEBF4D90FAE4A0.description: capitalization of proper nouns, including abbreviations, initials, acronyms, and organizations;

ED78649E9D9C4D25A6B2ADEF826FA26B.description: subordinating conjunctions to form complex sentences and correlative conjunctions;

4A5F391A5B4F4865AA8E35657D1252F3.description: pronouns, including personal, possessive, objective, reflexive, prepositional, indefinite, and relative;

FC0017ECF5B64C2D924633AC1765E36F.description: prepositions and prepositional phrases and their influence on subject-verb agreement;

81ADAA8DCDFA4EE987DE8E72AC2B4508.description: consistent, appropriate use of verb tenses;

694AB19758404DA09DC3D721A6CF17C7.description: complete complex sentences with subject-verb agreement and avoidance of splices, run-ons, and fragments;

7B754A083E834C9DA30B8501E851969D.description: edit drafts using standard Spanish conventions, including:

6226F3408C914BC4AD9F0813C47C91D9.description: revise drafts for clarity, development, organization, style, word choice, and sentence variety;

E212F579494C409687BD91C574105CF5.description: developing an engaging idea reflecting depth of thought with specific facts and details;

EB20A5937F4E48B68859B9EB3536587E.description: organizing with purposeful structure, including an introduction, transitions, coherence within and across paragraphs, and a conclusion; and

9BC6BC64578C427CA19E998850D35587.description: develop drafts into a focused, structured, and coherent piece of writing by:

DEA41765968A4B238523B69E7D505962.description: plan a first draft by selecting a genre appropriate for a particular topic, purpose, and audience using a range of strategies such as discussion, background reading, and personal interests;

E3E7C84BD6EA4FF8809A94193A98D30D.description: Composition: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--writing process. The student uses the writing process recursively to compose multiple texts that are legible and uses appropriate conventions. The student is expected to:

0A3AF565AF3E42559926A7537AAFBF27.description: explain the differences between rhetorical devices and logical fallacies.

FD148DADC0464AEEA260D191D5E6129B.description: analyze how the author's use of language contributes to mood and voice; and

8874DBA5BA264C57A796FC2A5F538776.description: identify the use of literary devices, including omniscient and limited point of view, to achieve a specific purpose;

80D78CC37AA048A5B58793CA1FAAA98E.description: describe how the author's use of figurative language such as metaphor and personification achieves specific purposes;

A0D5A041F29F40A8B17F0AE1EF8064CE.description: analyze the author's use of print and graphic features to achieve specific purposes;

B93253CB39D3439392B41450E708ED79.description: analyze how the use of text structure contributes to the author's purpose;

396322728CE04AB8B007542D3D83A24B.description: explain the author's purpose and message within a text;

50B6D5AD4D2C42DA827E24728195BBBD.description: Author's purpose and craft: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. The student uses critical inquiry to analyze the authors' choices and how they influence and communicate meaning within a variety of texts. The student analyzes and applies author's craft purposefully in order to develop his or her own products and performances. The student is expected to:

35F1FE82F57C4AC681EC48415809C97F.description: analyze characteristics of multimodal and digital texts.

5C5190E7FEF649E6BF3840B1ABB3FEA3.description: identifying the intended audience or reader; and

3AC182E41B3A4B9B86966D1FA1F04E69.description: explaining how the author uses various types of evidence to support the argument; and

C93F3E7FDCD5494F8823589366C344F3.description: analyze characteristics and structures of argumentative text by:

848B967AC767420FA8B77040D8C9CB51.description: organizational patterns such as definition, classification, advantage, and disadvantage;

2440C69D61A24E94957969180FFCE8F4.description: features such as introduction, foreword, preface, references, or acknowledgements to gain background information; and

086ACA7FAAC346D69D64CAC9B45DDA63.description: the controlling idea or thesis with supporting evidence;

45A23635D86E4DC49636EAE136847453.description: analyze characteristics and structural elements of informational text, including:

85BE81611C9D49498CA249C5D1B9A136.description: analyze how playwrights develop characters through dialogue and staging;

3CDE606996844EC199A45177B115D9BC.description: analyze the effect of meter and structural elements such as line breaks in poems across a variety of poetic forms;

5C78FE1DD1144E44A5E8FB3277B623ED.description: demonstrate knowledge of literary genres such as realistic fiction, adventure stories, historical fiction, mysteries, humor, and myths;

85F5B68A034A48E9830ECEBC5DBD6CD8.description: Multiple genres: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--genres. The student recognizes and analyzes genre-specific characteristics, structures, and purposes within and across increasingly complex traditional, contemporary, classical, and diverse texts. The student is expected to:

BB656078CF2C4E28A361B562B83B0B93.description: analyze how the setting, including historical and cultural settings, influences character and plot development.

17C77A4A7893458AADDA1491A5759647.description: analyze plot elements, including rising action, climax, falling action, resolution, and non-linear elements such as flashback; and

ACC3CAE7BB09491CBAFB9BFDBDA4699A.description: analyze how the characters' internal and external responses develop the plot;

6732F62313A6473693C71A4B29242DBE.description: infer multiple themes within and across texts using text evidence;

28F1FF090618427781DBEE2ACE2AE1F5.description: Multiple genres: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--literary elements. The student recognizes and analyzes literary elements within and across increasingly complex traditional, contemporary, classical, and diverse literary texts. The student is expected to:

49FC6E06B2E44723AB2CCDAC120994C7.description: reflect on and adjust responses as new evidence is presented.

5E9EF5BA76FF44D786E3BA27C660C3BF.description: respond orally or in writing with appropriate register, vocabulary, tone, and voice; and

B2328249FBAE4950A01F7BB116429667.description: discuss and write about the explicit or implicit meanings of text;

A2CE0C3803AF41648028B159D69CF059.description: respond using newly acquired vocabulary as appropriate;

90B35FF5216A4CCD80C128DC61F93FBE.description: interact with sources in meaningful ways such as notetaking, annotating, freewriting, or illustrating;

7C13CFF5732D4A04A1C8EB8923901C19.description: paraphrase and summarize texts in ways that maintain meaning and logical order;

52139F4EF62E48C4A765943E9E714A15.description: use text evidence to support an appropriate response;

2672AAB0BC404C47AE2CF56DE5622D3B.description: write responses that demonstrate understanding of texts, including comparing sources within and across genres;

88F6651035BA48509FEEABC41DD696D5.description: describe personal connections to a variety of sources, including self-selected texts;

23DF28407E574A6CA557D5A1772BA7C6.description: Response skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. The student responds to an increasingly challenging variety of sources that are read, heard, or viewed. The student is expected to:

709C1FB1535244BAB6869099BA03F9B5.description: monitor comprehension and make adjustments such as re-reading, using background knowledge, asking questions, and annotating when understanding breaks down.

6EF9E25F692F4E538D800E4FA97EDB67.description: synthesize information to create new understanding; and

AFBB284D0B8441D8B39D8138D95A2093.description: evaluate details read to determine key ideas;

BE8A005A2AA94B828279590C56810B2B.description: make inferences and use evidence to support understanding;

ECA3865608224042B1B78E9B49FE1168.description: make connections to personal experiences, ideas in other texts, and society;

988DD8B7A94D4E33BD6682A5063296B1.description: create mental images to deepen understanding;

AF3473ADEAC74EFBBBFA36C5308C04AF.description: make and correct or confirm predictions using text features, characteristics of genre, and structures;

721F5A9E9196409AB3D50FB55D18EE19.description: generate questions about text before, during, and after reading to deepen understanding and gain information;

8A5F55E6C96745228B2C74C766A4BD28.description: establish purpose for reading assigned and self-selected text;

8690C21A8EE243308AF17D62555A48B0.description: Comprehension skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. The student uses metacognitive skills to both develop and deepen comprehension of increasingly complex texts. The student is expected to:

3516D63582AE4FD39560E1F6050D68E1.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking--self-sustained reading. The student reads grade-appropriate texts independently. The student is expected to self-select text and read independently for a sustained period of time.

055ADF6D63414E7CA5E1452A60C1BD6C.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking--fluency. The student reads grade-level text with fluency and comprehension. The student is expected to adjust fluency when reading grade-level text based on the reading purpose.

092E0CF2676D462CAD644F9D6450D652.description: differentiate between and use homographs, homophones, and commonly confused terms such as porque/porqué/por qué/por que, sino/si no, and también/tan bien.

804FF1C779F64F588D4123D6B2787792.description: determine the meaning and usage of grade-level academic Spanish words derived from Greek and Latin roots, including metro-, grafo-, scrib-, and port-; and

FE8D6B90A952493DB4D587464FDAD12A.description: use context such as definition, analogy, and examples to clarify the meaning of words;

EB44C8E7F33243B7A55F66A690E800F4.description: use print or digital resources to determine the meaning, syllabication, pronunciation, word origin, and part of speech;

7EA96B31DAD448E0983E73016071F616.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking--vocabulary. The student uses newly acquired vocabulary expressively. The student is expected to:

F6735B1D30B24FC29A690D49D9EC5AFC.description: spelling words with diphthongs and hiatus; and

B01579BD30324D65AACB546958FD159B.description: marking accents appropriately when conjugating verbs in simple and imperfect past, perfect conditional, and future tenses; and

3C02F9AD7FDC46DBAEC64766405FFD75.description: spelling palabras agudas, graves, esdrújulas, and sobresdrújulas (words with the stress on the antepenultimate, penultimate, and ultimate/last syllable and words with the stress on the syllable before the antepenultimate);

8A1729DB64F449F8AC7ECB3672405D4A.description: demonstrate and apply spelling knowledge by:

4BB8A57771004DB5A299F6C5EAC06CC6.description: using knowledge of syllable division patterns and morphemes to decode multisyllabic words;

A5741BFDA4B941B2B71ECEAEE2CA8A74.description: decoding words with hiatus and diphthongs; and

5DA15553D38B4B14B28CA9D891D22654.description: decoding palabras agudas, graves, esdrújulas, and sobresdrújulas (words with the stress on the last, penultimate, and antepenultimate syllable and words with the stress on the syllable before the antepenultimate);

01F7222DADC747B4BFACC9FA051511BC.description: differentiating between commonly confused terms such as porque/porqué/por qué/por que, asimismo (adverbio)/así mismo (de la misma manera), sino/si no, and también/tan bien;

6FFE75C197754211A19C4D00D6A48458.description: demonstrate and apply phonetic knowledge by:

8D4BA2BC130D4BA98E2DABF77F9D8A5C.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking--beginning reading and writing. The student develops word structure knowledge through phonological awareness, print concepts, phonics, and morphology to communicate, decode, and spell. The student is expected to:

007FDE9CE1AF40C6863B79CF393ECFB0.description: participate in student-led discussions by eliciting and considering suggestions from other group members, taking notes, and identifying points of agreement and disagreement.

67381EB266A7489B97AC44E5841173E6.description: give an organized presentation with a specific stance and position, employing eye contact, speaking rate, volume, enunciation, natural gestures, and conventions of language to communicate ideas effectively; and

C0FE3E284AAE4FDEA51CADD502D00F10.description: follow and give oral instructions that include multiple action steps;

79398DCB548946CEA3E3B39253FB9567.description: listen actively to interpret a message, ask clarifying questions, and respond appropriately;

4FE1085035F14769B71FDBC596F15C77.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, discussion, and thinking--oral language. The student develops oral language through listening, speaking, and discussion. The student is expected to:
